verses.verse: Against Moab<WH4124> thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>; Woe<WH1945> unto Nebo<WH5015>! for it is spoiled<WH7703>: Kiriathaim<WH7156> is confounded<WH3001> and taken<WH3920>: Misgab<WH4869> is confounded<WH3001> and dismayed<WH2865>. Misgab: or, the high place

There shall be no more praise<WH8416> of Moab<WH4124>: in Heshbon<WH2809> they have devised<WH2803> evil<WH7451> against it; come<WH3212>, and let us cut it off<WH3772> from being a nation<WH1471>. Also thou shalt be cut down<WH1826>, O Madmen<WH4086>; the sword<WH2719> shall pursue<WH3212> thee<WH310>. be cut: or, be brought to silence pursue: Heb. go after thee
A voice<WH6963> of crying<WH6818> shall be from Horonaim<WH2773>, spoiling<WH7701> and great<WH1419> destruction<WH7667>.
Moab<WH4124> is destroyed<WH7665>; her little ones<WH6810> have caused a cry<WH2201> to be heard<WH8085>.

For in the going up<WH4608> of Luhith<WH3872> continual<WH1065> weeping<WH1065> shall go up<WH5927>; for in the going down<WH4174> of Horonaim<WH2773> the enemies<WH6862> have heard<WH8085> a cry<WH6818> of destruction<WH7667>. continual: Heb. weeping with weeping
Flee<WH5127>, save<WH4422> your lives<WH5315>, and be<WH1961> like the heath<WH6176> in the wilderness<WH4057>. the heath: or, a naked tree

For because thou hast trusted<WH982> in thy works<WH4639> and in thy treasures<WH214>, thou shalt also be taken<WH3920>: and Chemosh<WH3645> shall go forth<WH3318> into captivity<WH1473> with his priests<WH3548> and his princes<WH8269> together<WH3162>.

And the spoiler<WH7703> shall come<WH935> upon every city<WH5892>, and no city<WH5892> shall escape<WH4422>: the valley<WH6010> also shall perish<WH6>, and the plain<WH4334> shall be destroyed<WH8045>, as the LORD<WH3068> hath spoken<WH559>.
Give<WH5414> wings<WH6731> unto Moab<WH4124>, that it may flee<WH5323> and get away<WH3318>: for the cities<WH5892> thereof shall be desolate<WH8047>, without any to dwell<WH3427> therein<WH2004>.

Cursed<WH779> be he that doeth<WH6213> the work<WH4399> of the LORD<WH3068> deceitfully<WH7423>, and cursed<WH779> be he that keepeth back<WH4513> his sword<WH2719> from blood<WH1818>. deceitfully: or, negligently

Moab<WH4124> hath been at ease<WH7599> from his youth<WH5271>, and he hath settled<WH8252> on his lees<WH8105>, and hath not been emptied<WH7324> from vessel<WH3627> to vessel<WH3627>, neither hath he gone<WH1980> into captivity<WH1473>: therefore his taste<WH2940> remained<WH5975> in him, and his scent<WH7381> is not changed<WH4171>. remained: Heb. stood

Therefore, behold, the days<WH3117> come<WH935>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, that I will send<WH7971> unto him wanderers<WH6808>, that shall cause him to wander<WH6808>, and shall empty<WH7324> his vessels<WH3627>, and break<WH5310> their bottles<WH5035>.
And Moab<WH4124> shall be ashamed<WH954> of Chemosh<WH3645>, as the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> was ashamed<WH954> of Bethel<WH1008> their confidence<WH4009>.
How say<WH559> ye, We are mighty<WH1368> and strong<WH2428> men<WH582> for the war<WH4421>?

Moab<WH4124> is spoiled<WH7703>, and gone up<WH5927> out of her cities<WH5892>, and his chosen<WH4005> young men<WH970> are gone down<WH3381> to the slaughter<WH2874>, saith<WH5002> the King<WH4428>, whose name<WH8034> is the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>. his: Heb. the choice of
The calamity<WH343> of Moab<WH4124> is near<WH7138> to come<WH935>, and his affliction<WH7451> hasteth<WH4116> fast<WH3966>.

All ye that are about<WH5439> him, bemoan<WH5110> him; and all ye that know<WH3045> his name<WH8034>, say<WH559>, How is the strong<WH5797> staff<WH4294> broken<WH7665>, and the beautiful<WH8597> rod<WH4731>!

Thou daughter<WH1323> that dost inhabit<WH3427> Dibon<WH1769>, come down<WH3381> from thy glory<WH3519>, and sit<WH3427> in thirst<WH6772>; for the spoiler<WH7703> of Moab<WH4124> shall come<WH5927> upon thee, and he shall destroy<WH7843> thy strong holds<WH4013>.

O inhabitant<WH3427> of Aroer<WH6177>, stand<WH5975> by the way<WH1870>, and espy<WH6822>; ask<WH7592> him that fleeth<WH5127>, and her that escapeth<WH4422>, and say<WH559>, What is done<WH1961>? inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress
Moab<WH4124> is confounded<WH3001>; for it is broken down<WH2865>: howl<WH3213> and cry<WH2199>; tell<WH5046> ye it in Arnon<WH769>, that Moab<WH4124> is spoiled<WH7703>,
And judgment<WH4941> is come<WH935> upon the plain<WH4334> country<WH776>; upon Holon<WH2473>, and upon Jahazah<WH3096>, and upon Mephaath<WH4158>,
And upon Dibon<WH1769>, and upon Nebo<WH5015>, and upon Bethdiblathaim<WH1015>,
And upon Kiriathaim<WH7156>, and upon Bethgamul<WH1014>, and upon Bethmeon<WH1010>,
And upon Kerioth<WH7152>, and upon Bozrah<WH1224>, and upon all the cities<WH5892> of the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, far<WH7350> or near<WH7138>.
The horn<WH7161> of Moab<WH4124> is cut off<WH1438>, and his arm<WH2220> is broken<WH7665>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>.
Make ye him drunken<WH7937>: for he magnified<WH1431> himself against the LORD<WH3068>: Moab<WH4124> also shall wallow<WH5606> in his vomit<WH6892>, and he also shall be in derision<WH7814>.

For was not Israel<WH3478> a derision<WH7814> unto thee? was he found<WH4672> among thieves<WH1590>? for since<WH1767> thou spakest<WH1697> of him, thou skippedst<WH5110> for joy. skippedst: or, movedst thyself

O ye that dwell<WH3427> in Moab<WH4124>, leave<WH5800> the cities<WH5892>, and dwell<WH7931> in the rock<WH5553>, and be like the dove<WH3123> that maketh her nest<WH7077> in the sides<WH5676> of the hole's<WH6354> mouth<WH6310>.

We have heard<WH8085> the pride<WH1347> of Moab<WH4124>, (he is exceeding<WH3966> proud<WH1343>) his loftiness<WH1363>, and his arrogancy<WH1346>, and his pride<WH1347>, and the haughtiness<WH7312> of his heart<WH3820>.

I know<WH3045> his wrath<WH5678>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>; but it shall not be so; his lies<WH907> shall not so effect<WH6213> it. his lies: or, those on whom he stayeth (Heb. his bars) do not right
Therefore will I howl<WH3213> for Moab<WH4124>, and I will cry out<WH2199> for all Moab<WH4124>; mine heart shall mourn<WH1897> for the men<WH582> of Kirheres<WH7025>.

O vine<WH1612> of Sibmah<WH7643>, I will weep<WH1058> for thee with the weeping<WH1065> of Jazer<WH3270>: thy plants<WH5189> are gone over<WH5674> the sea<WH3220>, they reach<WH5060> even to the sea<WH3220> of Jazer<WH3270>: the spoiler<WH7703> is fallen<WH5307> upon thy summer fruits<WH7019> and upon thy vintage<WH1210>.

And joy<WH8057> and gladness<WH1524> is taken<WH622> from the plentiful field<WH3759>, and from the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>; and I have caused wine<WH3196> to fail<WH7673> from the winepresses<WH3342>: none shall tread<WH1869> with shouting<WH1959>; their shouting<WH1959> shall be no shouting<WH1959>.

From the cry<WH2201> of Heshbon<WH2809> even unto Elealeh<WH500>, and even unto Jahaz<WH3096>, have they uttered<WH5414> their voice<WH6963>, from Zoar<WH6820> even unto Horonaim<WH2773>, as an heifer<WH5697> of three years old<WH7992>: for the waters<WH4325> also of Nimrim<WH5249> shall be desolate<WH4923>. desolate: Heb. desolations
Moreover I will cause to cease<WH7673> in Moab<WH4124>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, him that offereth<WH5927> in the high places<WH1116>, and him that burneth incense<WH6999> to his gods<WH430>.

Therefore mine heart<WH3820> shall sound<WH1993> for Moab<WH4124> like pipes<WH2485>, and mine heart<WH3820> shall sound<WH1993> like pipes<WH2485> for the men<WH582> of Kirheres<WH7025>: because the riches<WH3502> that he hath gotten<WH6213> are perished<WH6>.

For every head<WH7218> shall be bald<WH7144>, and every beard<WH2206> clipped<WH1639>: upon all the hands<WH3027> shall be cuttings<WH1417>, and upon the loins<WH4975> sackcloth<WH8242>. clipped: Heb. diminished

There shall be lamentation<WH4553> generally upon all the housetops<WH1406> of Moab<WH4124>, and in the streets<WH7339> thereof: for I have broken<WH7665> Moab<WH4124> like a vessel<WH3627> wherein is no pleasure<WH2656>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>.

They shall howl<WH3213>, saying, How is it broken down<WH2865>! how hath Moab<WH4124> turned<WH6437> the back<WH6203> with shame<WH954>! so shall Moab<WH4124> be a derision<WH7814> and a dismaying<WH4288> to all them about<WH5439> him. back: Heb. neck
For thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>; Behold, he shall fly<WH1675> as an eagle<WH5404>, and shall spread<WH6566> his wings<WH3671> over Moab<WH4124>.

Kerioth<WH7152> is taken<WH3920>, and the strong holds<WH4679> are surprised<WH8610>, and the mighty men's<WH1368> hearts<WH3820> in Moab<WH4124> at that day<WH3117> shall be as the heart<WH3820> of a woman<WH802> in her pangs<WH6887>. Kerioth: or, The cities
And Moab<WH4124> shall be destroyed<WH8045> from being a people<WH5971>, because he hath magnified<WH1431> himself against the LORD<WH3068>.
Fear<WH6343>, and the pit<WH6354>, and the snare<WH6341>, shall be upon thee, O inhabitant<WH3427> of Moab<WH4124>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>.

He that fleeth<WH5127> <WH5211> from<WH6440> the fear<WH6343> shall fall<WH5307> into the pit<WH6354>; and he that getteth up<WH5927> out of the pit<WH6354> shall be taken<WH3920> in the snare<WH6341>: for I will bring<WH935> upon it, even upon Moab<WH4124>, the year<WH8141> of their visitation<WH6486>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>.

They that fled<WH5127> stood<WH5975> under the shadow<WH6738> of Heshbon<WH2809> because of the force<WH3581>: but a fire<WH784> shall come forth<WH3318> out of Heshbon<WH2809>, and a flame<WH3852> from the midst<WH996> of Sihon<WH5511>, and shall devour<WH398> the corner<WH6285> of Moab<WH4124>, and the crown of the head<WH6936> of the tumultuous<WH7588> ones<WH1121>. tumultuous: Heb. children of noise

Woe<WH188> be unto thee, O Moab<WH4124>! the people<WH5971> of Chemosh<WH3645> perisheth<WH6>: for thy sons<WH1121> are taken<WH3947> captives<WH7628>, and thy daughters<WH1323> captives<WH7633>. captives, and: Heb. in captivity, etc
Yet will I bring again<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of Moab<WH4124> in the latter<WH319> days<WH3117>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>. Thus far<WH2008> is the judgment<WH4941> of Moab<WH4124>.
